title: Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for poetess Maria Maddalena Morelli", after 1795
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: In a landscape with a citadel rising in the background at right, a monument stands upon a pedestal of three oval plinths. The monument is an urn surrounded by a group of three Gods: Apollo (at right, holding a lyre), Tiber (at left, holding a spear), and Minerva (in center, holding a laurel wreath). The gods are bestowing honors upon the bust atop the urn. The bust is inscribed with "CORILLA", and the urn with INPROVISO/ SI.BENE.CHE./ FU.CORONATA./ IN/ CAMPIDOGLIO".

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for poetess Maria Maddalena Morelli", after 1795.
after 1795. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-280.
